title: Koi Pond
description: Michael is upset when he becomes the butt of all the office jokes after he falls in a koi pond. Andy and Pam go out together on some cold calls, and everybody mistakes them as a married couple.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Welcome children of the Scranton Industrial Park Community.

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: YAY!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Join your gangsta pumpkin on his palette truck of doom. Don't worry about a thing. Rest assured you will see me later. Bwah ha ha...  [bumps into something] ... ha ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We are doing a haunted house this Halloween. Which is actually kinda spooky because, as legend has it, on this very site there used to be a productive paper company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am going to scare these kids so bad.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is the spookiest warehouse in the world, kids. You don't believe me? Just take a look. [Kevin chops into Erin, who is dressed as Princess Fiona] Oh. Scary, huh? This is a surgery with an octopus and a burn victim.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Black widow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Lulu from The Fifth Element.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nobody told me what people were, alright? So...  label yourselves or take what you get.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I want to sell your blood!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's really not the trend in vampires right now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Here is an old man and a goth dude... and then the old crone from Drag Me to Hell.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm a hobo.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I asked for a list. [Dwight rides in on a tricycle, laughing diabolically] ...and a clown.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm Jigsaw, idiot.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're not as scary as Book Face, over there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. I am the popular social networking site known as Book Face.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ok, kids. You've all been so good and unbelievably patient so I think you are gonna get some candy!

quotes.speaker: Kids
quotes.text: Yeah! [a chair falls over, Michael is seen hanging from the ceiling with a noose around his neck - the kids scream]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kids, just remember, suicide is never the answer. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why is Christmas the only holiday that can have a message?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is the easy way out. You are not alone.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who wants candy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...and then I think I'm going to go to the Garlic Festival.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds like fun. You guys would love it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I bet we would.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They have a TCBY booth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The same stuff you get downtown.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you like TCBY?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who doesn't?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't believe it's- I can't believe it's yogurt. Uh... it'll be fun

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I confirmed with Raskin Design and they're expecting the both of you in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Actually, it's just gonna be me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: They said the both of you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is a mistake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You should give them a call. Check that out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. Let's clear this up. [on phone] Well, there's actually been a few changes in the company and Michael and I are actually at the same level. So, I can- no. Nope. Why would that be a problem?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim's a good kid. He can handle a lot but sometimes you have to call in a master. I, uh... why would you date an amateur when you could date a professional?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. See ya' then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wha- what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: They said that they would feel more comfortable if you came along.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why don't they just want you to go by yourself? Why do they want me to come, too? I don't understand.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I absolutely don't understand, either.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't want you to feel like I'm baby-sitting you, or something. Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let me get your stroller.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure. Michael's a good teacher. A teacher is someone who stands right next to you your whole life and never lets you do anything. That's what a teacher is, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you gonna call him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. What is his name?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dave.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mr. Bourchard. They're very formal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. I've spoken to them on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well... this is not the phone. This is real life, baby, and you gotta own it. Is that what you are wearing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...and that is the watch that you are going to wear? No. It is not. You should wear this watch. I will loan it to you. It is a Tankard. I highly recommend you wear that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They are into style.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They are into appearance. We are selling success.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...and paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's sorta secondary. [offers Jim the watch again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's trying to micro-co-manage me... or co-micro... manage... me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here we are outside-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: WB!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: - the Wilkes-Barre Industrial Park.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Industrial P.! Makin' cold calls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The two people with the lowest sales in the quarter have to do them.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Where are you? Dean Trophies. Suite 100. Sherman  Blinds and Rugs. Suite 202.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here it is. [Andy is still singing] Suite 401.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I was gonna sing that part.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. Now you don't have to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Except it was going to resolve the melody, so now my head hurts. Feels like I held in a sneeze. Mmm! I hate this feeling. [sings] Suite 401.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Hi. Any messages?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're soaking wet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, well, Jim and I got caught in a little flash rain, flash wind, flash lightning.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wow. Sounds scary.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was. It was. And then in an instant it wasn't.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why isn't Jim wet?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I outran it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I don't think it rained. My hip would be throbbing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It rained.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, can I get you something? A towel? Some cocoa?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing. Cocoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll just leave that suit in your office then.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Yep.

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Must be nice to have company on these cold calls.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're kind of a dynamic duo. Or trio. [points to Pam's tummy]

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: How exciting! Do you guys know the sex yet?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Andy shakes his head 'no'] Oh. No, no. [laughing] We're not together. No, no, no. Definitely not. Definitely not. No. We just work together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [miffed] Looks like somebody's got a case of the definitelies.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Michael is walking around in one of Jim's suits] Um, Michael? The custodian from Raskin Design is on the line. He said they found your keys in the Koi pond.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Did you say 'Koi pond'?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [phone rings] Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael, people are asking questions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Put them on speaker. Hey guys, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, did you you fall into a Koi pond?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... I can't really hear you. I think we have sort of a bad connection.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jim, did Michael fall into a Koi pond?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm... it's like Michael said. It was some- something else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was- Ok. This is what it was. It was these bunch of idiots who had put a fish tank in the ground with no cover and no railing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So you fell in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Maybe I was trying to save a child that had fallen in.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So a child had fallen in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not yet!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is hilarious. [extends hand for a fist bump]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it is- don't! I'm not gonna bump. I'm not gonna bump. And it was not hilarious. It was very, very terrifying. [Stanley laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Truthfully, it wasn't the way he fell in. It was... how long it took him to get out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we'd like to offer you 15% off your first purchase as our way of welcoming you to the area.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.text: Well that sounds like a really nice deal.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sha-bow.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.text: And I must say, that since we are a family business it is nice to see that you are, too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, wow. You thought that- oh, my gosh. Oh. Definitely not.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.text: My mistake. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nuh. Actually, it's kinda not ok. Um, I date models. Face models. My girlfriend, on a scale of one to Giselle, uh... a nine.

quotes.speaker: Customer
quotes.text: That- that's good for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Anyway, we also have a special on envelopes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pam's carrying our surrogate. Because my girlfriend needed to keep her figure for fashion week. So, we, uh, we put our baby in Pam.  Doesn't matter what Pam looks like.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You were way meaner to me than I was to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No I wasn't. Ok. The very idea of us together made you burst out laughing like you just bit into an Adam Sandler and jelly sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You blew the sale, you idiot.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let me tell you something. I was never gonna make that sale.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin, do we have any of those clips that hold paper together?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Staples? [Kevin clears his throat] Uh, David Wallace called.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. He did? What did he say?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He heard you made a big splash at the meeting. Oh, my God. That was so mean what I just said and I didn't mean it. It was Kevin and Meredith put me up to it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [whispers to Erin] I'm gonna kill you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Michael, don't listen to them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You just ignore their carp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A carp is both a fish and a term for complaing. They're mocking you with wordplay.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, boss, did you find Nemo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can name Pixar movies, too. Toy Story.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Don't you mean 'Koi Story'?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: And when you fell in, did you flounder?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, flounder is both a kind of fish and -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know what a flounder is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not usually the butt of the joke. I'm usually the face of the joke. I wish Jim had fallen into that pond and he'd have to put on my suit and it'd be too short and he'd look... Damn it! He'd still look good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The most fundamental thing about sensitivity training is that you cannot make fun of a person for something or some action that they have done that they regret. Show of hands- who has been 'Koi-ponded'? Who here's been the butt of a joke that has gone too far? Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, you make fun of us every day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. Every single day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You never said anything.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Uh, we have. Countless times.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it is hard to tell the difference between you guys saying, 'Stop because I want you to stop' or STOP as in 'Stop. You're making me laugh so hard. What you're doing is so funny. You are on a roll. I am busting a gut. Stop!'

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's never the case.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are going to make a 'Do Not Mock' list. Ok? Anything that we think might be out of bounds, we put on this list. Anything you put on this list you cannot be teased about. Got it? I'm gonna kick it off. Let's see what I have to put on the list, right? [writes 'Koi pond' on the list] Ok. I also have fallen into the fountain at the Steamtown Mall. Ok. Who else? Who else? Dwight, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't want people making fun of my nose.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Your nose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's too small.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh my. That is small.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just, write it down, please.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you breathe okay?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What keeps your glasses on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey! It's on the list, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. I haven't finished writing. Did you sneeze it off? That's it. No more. Ok. Who else? Who else? Everybody's getting their chance.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't want people making fun of my weight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. That's to broad. It's gotta be something else. How 'bout your stomach? Yeah? [writes Huge Gut] Meredith?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I don't want to say it out loud.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Fine. Come on up here. Write it yourself. And don't sign your name to it. And nobody look. Everybody look away. Look away.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I really didn't want to put it on the board but I thought maybe it was gonna come out somehow so... what are you gonna do? [she writes 'sex with a terrorist']

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is our sales pitch and we are stickin' to it.

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: Well, you two are quite the salesmen and a very cute couple.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh- [both look at each other and together say] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: Some couples don't seem like a good match. You two do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, you know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. You know. Two peas in a pod. We complete each other. What can I say? She loves to cook-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He loves to eat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I love to dance-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love to watch him dance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right. Sometimes I'll just dance for hours in the living room-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And I'll just watch him.

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: And a baby on the way? You must be so excited.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. We are thrilled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: In fact, we spent the whole weekend researching various birthing coaches. Wasn't that fun, honey?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: Oh. I know the best teacher. Her name is Miss Janet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. On Clearview Avenue.

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This sounds ridiculous, I know, but some people say that I eat like a squirrel.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So now you're comparing yourself to a cute, tiny animal?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Um, Michael? The custodian called again. Apparently a Koi has died. [everyone shows remorse]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's a fish.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: They want you to pay for it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It could've died of natural causes. So...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, they said you stepped on it's head. He did not suffer.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: When is the funeral?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do not mock, Oscar. Do not mock. How much do they want?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? No. I could get a fish for a 5 cent worm.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, you're payin' way too much for your worms, man. Who's your worm guy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok. Great meeting, everybody. That's it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [everyone begins to leave]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. We are not done here. This-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One of the baby books suggets the best birthing posture is on all fours, like an animal. I just wish I had a special telephone so I could find out exactly wht the little soy bean wants. Right? Hey, little soy bean. What do you want? Right. How do- It- I felt it kick!

quotes.speaker: Keena Gifford
quotes.text: That's great!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh. Like a little magical foot just high-fived me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, well, that'll happen.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, my gosh. It's like he's trying to say, 'I love you, too, Daddy'. I love you, too. [leans over and kisses Pam's belly]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sometimes we're so excited we forget where we are. Like at a business meeting.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Message received, little soy bean.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you just gotta ride this one out, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Jim. You don't understand. Things like this don't just die. Kids in high school still call me 'Ponytail'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, they don't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, they do, Jim. Because of the time I got my ponytail stuck in the power trail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe if you make fun of yourself it'll all go away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want to make fun of you right now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? Do it. I am a big, stupid goofball.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Don't do that. You're not. You're not stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. I- I just wanna say that I cannot believe that I walked into a Koi pond. I mean, seriously. Walk much? [everyone starts laughing] Oh. I should wear a snorkel to the next business meeting that I go to.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael. You know, when you think about it, it's not all your fault. I mean, who puts a Koi pond in a lobby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you know what? You're right, Phyllis, but I've been there before. I've seen that pond. This is the thing, I am a world class moron. That's the problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, please. Stop it now. You're embarrassing yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's ok. We're having fun. It's not actually the first time I've been embarrassed by a pond. In high school, the girls volleyball team always used to hrow me into the frozen lake. Four years in a row. Oh... it was freezing. [Jim signals for making to stop] No. No. No. Oh, this is even worse. [Michael begins to lose his cool] Couple weeks ago I went to get a new cellphone and I wanted on of those packages where you have, you know, the friends- the five- the friends and family thing and the guys was like, 'Who are your 5 friends?' and I'm, like, 'Uh... ' I didn't even know I couldn't even think. [realizing he's going downhill] Oh, my God. It was so embarrassing. That was- oh. I don't even have Jan's cell phone number and I hate her! She won't give it to me. I was like, 'Oh, I guess I'm a loser. 'A luh-whooooo a za her'.  Too far! God! Thanks a lot, man. Thanks for the advice.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [watching Angela eat something] Enjoying your nut?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm not mocking. I was just making an observation about a nut.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I was.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Who wants to watch Michael's pond dive? My roommate's friend is the night janitor over there. He swiped the security tape for me and he's bringing it over.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm... I'm, know what? Maybe we should go easy on Michael, guys. You know, you watch that tape and you're gonna have to stay late for more sensitity training, so...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: We'll stay late.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, that went pretty well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We got a maybe. It was our first maybe. Going by the Nard Dog curve, I'd say we nailed it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: If I'm being completely honest, I could've done without the belly kiss.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what? I'm sorry. 'Cause in that moment I knew I was kissing your belly too much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Way too much.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, what the hell was that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What the heck was that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When you cried?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Agh- try almost cried, ok? I just got caught up in the fantasy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're fantsy involves comparison shopping birthing classes?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. I know I'm gonna go with Miss Janet. I just- I don't know. It was fun to role play, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, it was fun for me. Having a wife and a little baby. Agh, I'm so sick of being single.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, are you dating anyone?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you think of Erin? I mean- she's- I- She's kinda cool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You think I can do better?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gotta get my goin' out on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, let's watch this thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Ok. Yeah. We're not watchin' this.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How can we not watch this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What happened to 'Do Not Mock'?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We're not mocking, we're watching.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That will inevitably lead to mocking. So...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, we'll deal with it as it comes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is this the tape of me falling?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes. Put the DVD in.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Open QuickTime.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It starts on it's own. Let it -

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No! Use QuickTime. Trust me. I've done this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guys. Michael can't handle this and as your boss I'm saying we're not watching it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. It's ok. Watch it. He can't fire all of you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's alright. I can handle it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am a grown-up, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Shh. It's on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Here they come. [everyone reacts to seeing Michael fall in] Boom!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh. Did - did you see that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See what?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why'd you stop it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oscar, yes. You're right to stop it. Thank you. Eject it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jim, you let Michael fall in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Play it again. [everyone has the same reaction as before] He purposefully leaned away and let you fall in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh... man. I thinke when I started to see you go in I think I just froze.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't think you froze.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's a killer new dance move. [re-enacts leaning back] Do you wanna talk in your office?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't ask you. [back to Michael] Would you like to talk? [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Judas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim is my enemy. But it turns out that Jim is also his own worst enemy. And the enemy of my enemy is my friend. So, Jim is actually my friend. But... because he is his own worst enemy, the enemy of my friend is my enemy. So, actually Jim is my enemy. But-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I should've grabbed you. I'm sorry. Look, I thought I could've done today's sales call alone. I mean, I may never be as good a salesman as you are, but I at least need the chance to do the job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim is jealous of me? Jim is jealous of me.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [as Jim enters the kitchen] Hey, what's up lifeguard?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jim, I think I'm in your way. [leans back - they both exit]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar's a douche.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughing] He's alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. He's a- yeah, he's alright. Ok. [holds door open as they exit]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're welcome. Whoa! [leans back] Almost fell. [they both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Erin. Do you mind faxing this for me?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, sure. Oh, wait. Hand them to me upside down so I don't accidentally read them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How did today go, by the way? Did you make any sales?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. It was a total waste of time. Um... it was fun, though, because I got to spend the day with Andy Bernard. He's really cool.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, he is!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he is.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's, like, the coolest person I've ever met.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's... right. He's like Marlon Brando.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. Do you mean Marlon Wayans? 'Cause he is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I actually do mean Marlon Wayan. Yeah.
